Class MTTabContainer

java.lang.Object
  org.mt4j.components.MTComponent
      widgets.AbstractGUIWidget
          widgets.MTTabContainer
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.mt4j.components.interfaces.IMTComponent, org.mt4j.components.interfaces.IMTComponent3D, org.mt4j.input.IMTInputEventListener, org.mt4j.input.inputProcessors.IGestureEventListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
StdMTTabContainer
public abstract class MTTabContainer
extends AbstractGUIWidget

This class represents a container for MTButtons. Thes tabs can be put in this container, which handles their alignment and positioning within this container. It groups them and provides them with the well known tab-functionality: the ability, to be only exclusively active, to be only active, if all other tabs are not. In order to do that, a special listener will be registered at the added tabs, which forwards tap-gestures right to the container, that then handles the request in the right way.

MTTabContainer

Main constructor

Parameters:

Method Detail

add

public boolean add(MTButton tab)
Adds the given tab to the tab-container. If the specified button is NULL or is already added to this tab-container, nothing happens.
If this is the first element to be put in the container, it will be marked as active.

Parameters:
tab - The new button to add as an MTButton
Returns:
Returns TRUE, if adding was successful, otherwise returns FALSE

remove

public boolean remove(MTButton tab)
Removes the given tab from the tab-container. If the specified button does not exist in this tab-container, nothing happens.
If the button to remove is the active one, the first one will be active

Parameters:
tab - The new button to remove as an MTButton
Returns:
Returns TRUE, if removal was successful, otherwise returns FALSE.

setAllTabs

public void setAllTabs(java.util.List<MTButton> tabs)
Sets the list of tabs according to the given list. If some button is found more than once in this list, just the first encounter of this button causes an appending to the container, you cannot add a button to this container more than once. If the specified list is NULL or emty, nothing happens. Under the hood, the first tab will be active, but you actually won't see it.

Parameters:
tabs - The a non-empty list of new tabs as a List of type MTButton

getTabList

public abstract java.util.List<MTButton> getTabList()
Retrieves the list of all tabs in this container.

Returns:
All tabs within this container as a List of type MTButton

setActiveTab

public boolean setActiveTab(MTButton tab)
Sets the active tab. If the specified tab is not associated with this container, no changes will be performed.

Parameters:
tab - The tab to set active as an MTButton
Returns:
Returns TRUE, if this action was successful, otherwise returns false

setActiveTab

public boolean setActiveTab(int pos)
Sets the active tab. If the tab at the specified position is not associated with this container, no changes will be performed.

Parameters:
pos - The index of the tab as an int
Returns:
Returns TRUE if the operation was successful, otherwise returns FALSE

Returnst the currently active tab

Returns:
The currently active tab as an MTButton

Returns:
The index currently active tab as an int
